ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Were you ever diagnosed with COVID-19 by a health care provider?
Do you know anyone who died from COVID-19?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= Prefer not to say; -9= Do not know

ElementDescription: Which of these people you know died from COVID-19? One or more of your parents
Which of these people you know died from COVID-19? Any other close relatives
Which of these people you know died from COVID-19? One or more of your close friends
Which of these people you know died from COVID-19? Anyone else you know (e.g., neighbors, classmates, acquaintances)
Think of the month when your stress related to the COVID-19 outbreak was greatest. During that month, how much stress did the outbreak cause you in Finances (e.g., you or your family lost income)
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Think of the month when your stress related to the COVID-19 outbreak was greatest. During that month, how much stress did the outbreak cause you in Difficulty getting access to food or supplies
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Think of the month when your stress related to the COVID-19 outbreak was greatest. During that month, how much stress did the outbreak cause you in Increased social isolation
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Think of the month when your stress related to the COVID-19 outbreak was greatest. During that month, how much stress did the outbreak cause you in Difficulty getting needed help to your loved ones
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Still thinking about that same month, how much stress did the COVID-19 outbreak cause: Increased arguments with people in your household
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Still thinking about that same month, how much stress did the COVID-19 outbreak cause: Increased arguments with other people (e.g., family, neighbors, coworkers)
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Still thinking about that same month, how much stress did the COVID-19 outbreak cause: Increased work demands (e.g., longer hours, more difficult work, more dangerous work)
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Still thinking about that same month, how much stress did the COVID-19 outbreak cause: Worry that you might get infected
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress

ElementDescription: Still thinking about that same month, how much stress did the COVID-19 outbreak cause: Worry that your loved ones might get infected
Notes: 0= No stress; 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Very severe stress
